result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:28 AM Defendant Savion T Grant in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Arthur August Baranowski in court for Savion T Grant.  Attorney Kyle Olson Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. 

IN CUSTODY
Re: Defense motion to reduce bail. Argument in support of motion by Atty Baranowski. Argument in opposition by ADA Olson.
Court makes ruling and will not make a bail change at this time.

11:06 AM Defendant Savion T Grant in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Arthur August Baranowski in court for Savion T Grant.  Attorney Lillian Nelson for Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. W Holtan, MAPD, duly sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Nelson. Witness ID'd DE. No cross. Witness excused. No further witnesses.  ADA moves for bindover, reserves argument. Atty Baranowski moves to dismiss count 2. CT finds probable cause & grants bindover.  Bail cont'd; ARGN to be set in trial branch.

Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant shall be within their residence between 9:00 PM and 6:00 AM except only for purposes of employment or to attend medical appointments. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2300 block of Allied Dr in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Tierra G.

02:25 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Will Rice Anderson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
